result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Richard J Harris

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial conference on January 13, 2023 at 09:45 am.

10:45 AM Defendant Richard J Harris appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Paul Arbuckle appeared by phone for Richard J Harris.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Prosecuting attorney Charles James Simono in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls 22CF30 and 22CF43. Attorney Arbuckle - not resolved - set for JT, no hurry. Court will make 22CF30 as #1 and 22CF43 as #2. Parties agree. Court continues bond on both cases, set for 2-day JT (22CF30) on 1/30/23 and 1/31/23 and set 22CF43 as 1 day trial on 1/31/23, set both matters for PTC on 1/13/23 at 9:45 AM.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 13, 2023 at 09:45 am.
Jury trial scheduled for January 31, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial on January 31, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on October 17, 2022 at 10:15 am.

8:35 AM Attorney Paul Arbuckle appeared by video for Richard J Harris. State of Wisconsin Alex Seifert appeared by video. Defendant Richard J Harris appeared by video from FO jail. Set for a pre-trial, parties are close to an agreement. Atty Arbuckle asked for another date. Bond continue. Set for new date and time.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 10:15 am.

9:33 AM Prosecuting attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Richard J Harris appeared by video, in custody.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Attorney Paul Arbuckle appeared by video for Richard J Harris. Court calls 22CF30 and 22CF43. State - here for ARGN on both matters, Information's have been filed. Harris waives his personal appearance today and will proceed via Zoom. Arbuckle and Harris have Information's, waives reading of them, enters NG pleas to all counts. Court accepts pleas on both cases, continues bond on both cases, set both cases for FPT on 9/2/22 at 8:30 AM.
Final pre-trial scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.

The DAR was recording in Shawano County
Final pre-trial on September 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Arraignment on July 25, 2022 at 09:15 am.

3:21 PM Prosecuting attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Richard J Harris appeared by video, in custody from FC jail.  Attorney Paul Arbuckle appeared by video for Richard J Harris. Called 22CF30 and 22CF43. State believes both cases are being waived. Attorney Arbuckle agrees. Court makes sure defendant is waiving his personal appearance today. Arbuckle and Harris agree to appear remotely. Attorney Arbuckle has verbally went over the waiver with Harris. Court goes over waiver with defendant, finds he is freely, voluntarily and intelligently waiving his right to preliminary hearing. Court finds probable cause and binds over for trial on each case. Arbuckle would like an ARGN date. Court schedules for ARGN and continues bond on each case.
Arraignment scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 09:15 am.
And Certificate of Appearance
Preliminary hearing on June 24, 2022 at 03:15 pm.
Preliminary hearing on June 24, 2022 at 03:15 pm.
Approved

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: 03:02 PM Defendant Richard J Harris in court with attorney Paul Arbuckle.  Defendant Richard J Harris in custody from FC jail.  Alexander Paul Seifert appeared for the Forest, County of. Court calls 22CF30 & 22CF43 - called for AIA. Arbuckle waives reading of complaints in both cases, asks for PH in each case and is willing to waive time limits in those cases. Court considers time limits waived and will have PH set. Court calls 19CM101 and 19CM58 - SAR packet has been filed. Arbuckle - states no inaccuracies. Court recites DOC recommendation. State - 103 days credit - stipulated and recites their recommendation. Total 2 years and 9 month sentence. Counts 1 & 3 in 19CM58 asking for 9 months in FC jail to run concurrent to each other. In 19CM101 asking for a 2 year prison sentence on counts 1, 2, 3 & 4 with 1.5 years of initial confinement followed by 6 months of extended supervision concurrent to each other but consecutive to jail sentence in 19CM58. Makes statement, recites criminal history and asks court to follow recommendation. Arbuckle makes statement and asks to follow DOC recommendation of 6-9 months. Harris makes statement, remorseful. Court has considered all statements, reviewed SAR packet, sentences to the following: 19CM58 - Count 1 - 9 months in FC jail. Count 3 - 9 months in FC jail, concurrent to count 1. Credit for 103 days of pre-conviction incarceration. In case 19CM101 - Count 1 - one year of incarceration, consecutive to counts 1 & 3 in 19CM58 and on counts 2, 3 & 4 - imposes one year of incarceration concurrent to each other and concurrent to count 1, but consecutive to case 19CM58. Arbuckle makes statement in regards to character. Court continues with statements in regards to character. Huber granted consistent with the sheriff's regulations and rules, entitled to good time if earned - up to the sheriff. Appeal rights given. Court questions if he owes on these cases. Clerk indicates on a payment plan and is current. Court orders not eligible for Huber or any other release from the jail until costs/fines are paid in full. PH scheduled for May 18, 2022 at 3:00 PM on other cases.
Adjourned initial appearance on May 25, 2022 at 09:30 am.

10:23 AM Defendant Richard J Harris in court, in custody.  Alexander Paul Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Richard J Harris appeared by video means from FOSO. Court calls 22CF30 and 22CF43. Attorney Arbuckle is listed as attorney of record on 22CF30. Court - Arbuckle now asks to appear telephonically even though JA gave him Zoom information, Arbuckle will need to appear in person in the future if he cannot figure out the technology, continues bond on both cases, sets both cases for AIA on 5/25/22 at 9:30 AM.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on April 20, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on April 20, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on April 13, 2022 at 09:45 am.

09:19 AM Defendant Richard J Harris in court, in custody.  Alexander Paul Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Richard J Harris appeared by video means from FOSO. Court calls 22CF43 and 22CF30. Court reviews file, counsel has not been appointed for either case, believes Harris was going to hire Cveykus. Harris states he had a conflict, talking with Attorney Joy now. Court continues bonds, sets both for AIA on 4/13/22 at 9:45 AM, let Court know if retain counsel.
Adjourned initial appearance on March 30, 2022 at 10:00 am.

09:29 AM Defendant Richard J Harris in court, in custody.  Alexander Paul Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Richard J Harris appeared by video means from FOSO. Harris states he does have counsel but there was a conflict - private counsel, does not have complaint. Harris has complaint. Court reads charges and penalties and right to attorney and court appointed attorney. Harris understands charges and penalties, does not live on Beech Street anymore, not sure of what address he will have, no cell phone. State - bond - $1000.00 signature bond. Court so orders, set for AIA on 3/30/22 at 10:00 AM, reminds him of his right to SPD or court appointed attorney. Defendant understands.
